text: Commins Menapi (18 September 1977 – 18 November 2017) was a Solomon Islands striker. He was last the manager of Western United. He guided them to their first and only Telekom S league title season 2014/2015. In the 2006–2007 season, he became the first player to be sent off in a New Zealand Football Championship Grand Final. He represented the Solomon Islands national football team on over 30 occasions, scoring a record 34 goals (including 7 against non- FIFA members). Menapi was arguably the most famous Solomon Islands footballer. Menapi died in Honiara on 18 November 2017 of a heart attack at the age of 40. ==References== ==Other websites== * Player profile – Waitakere club website Category:1977 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:Oceanic footballers Category:Solomon Islands people
title: Commins Menapi
